strapiPost.title: Arkansas Women's Track and Field Program Wins Program of the Year Award
strapiPost.content:
The Arkansas women’s track and field team has earned the Women’s Division I Program of the Year award for the first time in program history! 

  • Prestigious winnings: The accolade is the USTFCCCA’s Terry Crawford award, which has been awarded since 2009. It recognizes the top program based on team results during the NCAA cross country, indoor and outdoor track and field championships. 
  • On top: The Arkansas women’s track and field team walked away from the NCAA championships with ten first-team All-American athletes. Arkansas achieved the award with 1.5 points over BYU by placing eighth in NCAA Cross Country, fourth in NCAA Indoor, and sixth in NCAA Outdoor. 

Read more HERE.
